Description: Glazed composition shabti with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with a beard, crossed hands in relief(worn) holding a hoe and an adze, the leg section is inscribed with incised illegible Hieroglyphs; there is a back-pillar and a plinth beneath the feet.
Curator's comments: Sir Hans Sloane’s ‘Miscellanea’ catalogue is a bound volume in Central Archives containing seven separate catalogues: ‘Miscellanies’, ‘Antiquities’, ‘Seals’, ‘Pictures’, ‘Mathematical Instruments’, ‘Agate Handles’ and ‘Agate Cups, Bottles, Spoons’. Each contains numbered entries that list and describe objects collected by Sloane between the 1680s and 1750s. Each catalogue begins with object number one. Text from Sloane Miscellanea catalogue: Miscellanea Antiquities 285 "285. The same."; the same referring to Miscellanea Antiquities 273 "273. A very large Ægyptian idol in blew clay Figlina idola varieæ magnitudinis reperta in mummiarum ventra consuta." and to "282. The same wt. Hieroglyphicks. Isis Vid. no. 679". 269 was a shabti in Gualtieri's collection that Sloane catalogued in hins Antiquities later.
Condition: fair - hands and foot damaged, glaze discoloured
